message_1: What is the energy (in eV) of a gamma ray emitted during the decay of a radioactive nucleus if the gamma spectroscopy experiment observes a peak at an energy of 511 keV?
message_2:
To convert the energy of the gamma ray from keV (kilo-electron volts) to eV (electron volts), you simply multiply by 1000, as there are 1000 eV in 1 keV.

So, for a gamma ray with an energy of 511 keV:

Energy (eV) = 511 keV Ã— 1000 eV/keV = 511,000 eV

The energy of the gamma ray emitted during the decay of the radioactive nucleus is 511,000 eV.
